questions.question: What is the empirical formula of Eu-Ru(phen)3-MOF?
questions.answer: C120H72Eu2N26O22Ru2

questions.question: What is the photocatalytic activity of Eu-Ru(phen)3-MOF under visible-light irradiation?
questions.answer: Selective CO2 reduction to formate with a rate of 321.9 μmol h−1 mmolMOF−1

questions.question: What is the role of TEOA in the photocatalytic reaction?
questions.answer: TEOA acts as a sacrificial agent.

questions.question: What is the main advantage of using Eu-Ru(phen)3-MOF for photocatalytic CO2 reduction?
questions.answer: It has high efficiency for selective CO2 photo-reduction.

questions.question: How does the Eu-Ru(phen)3-MOF achieve charge separation for photocatalysis?
questions.answer: Through electron transfer from Ru(phen)3-derived tricarboxylate ligand to {Eu(III)}2 catalytic centers.

questions.question: What is the crystal system and space group of Eu-Ru(phen)3-MOF?
questions.answer: Orthorhombic crystal system with space group I222.

questions.question: What is the role of Eu2 clusters in the photocatalytic mechanism?
questions.answer: Eu2 clusters act as active sites for CO2 reduction.

questions.question: Is the Eu-Ru(phen)3-MOF stable after photocatalytic reactions?
questions.answer: Yes, it retains its structure and shows no noticeable degradation after three consecutive reactions.

questions.question: Does the Eu-Ru(phen)3-MOF produce H2, CH4, or CO as by-products in the photocatalytic reaction?
questions.answer: No, it does not produce H2, CH4, or CO as by-products.

questions.question: What is the method used for the structural determination of Eu-Ru(phen)3-MOF?
questions.answer: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction determination.

questions.question: What is the role of the Ru(phen)3-derived tricarboxylate ligand in Eu-Ru(phen)3-MOF?
questions.answer: It acts as a photosensitizer for the photocatalytic process.

questions.question: What is the main product of the photocatalytic CO2 reduction using Eu-Ru(phen)3-MOF?
questions.answer: Formate (HCOO−)

questions.question: Is the photocatalytic activity of Eu-Ru(phen)3-MOF selective?
questions.answer: Yes, it is selective for reducing CO2 to formate.

questions.question: What is the charge transfer time range observed in Eu-Ru(phen)3-MOF?
questions.answer: From 1.2 ns to 293.6 ns.

questions.question: What experimental technique was used to confirm the photo-induced electron injection process in Eu-Ru(phen)3-MOF?
questions.answer: In situ Electron Paramagnetic Resonance (EPR) experiments.

questions.question: Does the Eu-Ru(phen)3-MOF framework undergo interpenetration?
questions.answer: Yes, it features a twofold interpenetrated structure.

questions.question: What is the role of the Eu2+ species observed in the EPR spectrum under visible-light irradiation?
questions.answer: Eu2+ species indicate the formation of active catalytic centers for CO2 reduction.

questions.question: What is the estimated adsorption energy of CO2 on the active site of Eu1 ion in Eu-Ru(phen)3-MOF?
Can the Eu-Ru(phen)3-MOF be reused without significant loss in photocatalytic activity?
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What is the main advantage of integrating Ru-polypyridine photosensitizers into Eu cluster-based MOFs?
questions.answer: It enhances the catalytic activities on CO2 reduction under visible-light irradiation.
